test3: <1skills>Basic theory (What is testing, bug reports, documentation, types, methods, testing directions, etc.) SDLC, STLC</1skills> <2skills>What is a client-server architecture</2skills> <3skills>HTTP Methods of requests to the server</3skills> <4skills>HTTP server response codes</4skills> <5skills>Structures of HTTP requests and responses</5skills> <6skills>What is JSON, XML. Their structure</6skills> <7skills>API testing via Postman (JS, API autotests)</7skills> <8skills>Removing and reading logs from an external server</8skills> <9skills>Sniffing http web traffic via Charles and Fiddler</9skills> <10skills>Dev Tools of web browsers (Google Chrome, FireFox)</10skills> <11skills>VPN. (How it works, why you need it, how to use it, tool options)</11skills> <12skills>Mobile testing</12skills> <13skills>Feature iOS, Android, guidelines</13skills> <14skills>Building iOS applications on XCode. (Those who do not have a Mac computer, just look)</14skills> <15skills>Building Android applications on Android Studio</15skills> <16skills>ADB (android device management)</16skills> <17skills>Setting up proxy and vpn on iOS and Android</17skills> <18skills>Interception (sniffing) of mobile traffic via Charles and Fiddler on iOS and Android</18skills> <19skills>Command line (terminal) Linux (copying, creating, viewing, moving files on servers without a graphical interface)</19skills> <20skills>Basics of bash scripting, automation of routine tasks on the server</20skills> <21skills>Access to remote servers</21skills> <22skills>SQL basics (Create, Delete, Drop, Insert Into, Select, From, Where, Join)</22skills> <23skills>Postgres database (installation, configuration and use)</23skills> <24skills>Non-relational database Redis (installation, configuration and use)</24skills> <25skills>Load testing in Jmeter</25skills> <26skills>Scrum development methodology</26skills> <27skills>Test Design Techniques (Equivalence Classes, Boundary Values, Combinatorial Techniques (Pairwise, Orthogonal, Basic Choice, Every Choice), States and Transitions)</27skills> <28skills>Python. (Learning the basics. Creating a client-server application)</28skills>
